priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM NHLBI Coronary Artery Dissection Grade Responses Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C119018

self.title: CDISC SDTM NHLBI Coronary Artery Dissection Grade Responses Terminology

definition: A terminology codelist relevant to the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute grade for coronary artery dissection and perforation.
name: Coronary Artery Dissection NHLBI Grade Responses
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM NHLBI Coronary Artery Dissection Grade Responses Terminology
synonyms: Coronary Artery Dissection NHLBI Grade Responses

terms.definition: Minor radiolucencies within the lumen during contrast injection with no persistence after dye clearance. (Adapted from: Coronary artery angiographic changes after PTCA: Manual of Operations NHLBI PTCA Registry 1985-6:9)
terms.preferredTerm: NHLBI Coronary Artery Dissection Type A

terms.definition: Parallel tracts or double lumen separated by a radiolucent area during contrast injection with no persistence after dye clearance. (Adapted from: Coronary artery angiographic changes after PTCA: Manual of Operations NHLBI PTCA Registry 1985-6:9)
terms.preferredTerm: NHLBI Coronary Artery Dissection Type B

terms.definition: Extraluminal cap with persistence of contrast after dye clearance from the lumen. (Adapted from: Coronary artery angiographic changes after PTCA: Manual of Operations NHLBI PTCA Registry 1985-6:9)
terms.preferredTerm: NHLBI Coronary Artery Dissection Type C

terms.definition: Spiral luminal filling defect with delayed but complete distal flow. (Adapted from: Coronary artery angiographic changes after PTCA: Manual of Operations NHLBI PTCA Registry 1985-6:9)
terms.preferredTerm: NHLBI Coronary Artery Dissection Type D

terms.definition: New persistent filling defect with delayed antegrade flow. May represent thrombus. (Adapted from: Coronary artery angiographic changes after PTCA: Manual of Operations NHLBI PTCA Registry 1985-6:9)
terms.preferredTerm: NHLBI Coronary Artery Dissection Type E

terms.definition: Non-A-E types with total coronary occlusion and no distal antegrade flow. May represent thrombus. (Adapted from: Coronary artery angiographic changes after PTCA: Manual of Operations NHLBI PTCA Registry 1985-6:9)
terms.preferredTerm: NHLBI Coronary Artery Dissection Type F
